alert.note: Alert for Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 6:20PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN OSAGE...NORTHEASTERN CREEK...NORTHWESTERN OKMULGEE AND SOUTHERN TULSA COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM CDT... At 619 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Bristow to 3 miles northeast of Beggs. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Kiefer... Beggs... Mounds... Kellyville... Keystone State Park... Preston... Jenks Riverside Airport... Liberty... Gray... Hectorville... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 192 and 229. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
